raw_text:
Rock group Korn's guitarist quits
 
 The guitarist with US rock band Korn has quit the music business, saying he made the decision after experiencing a religious awakening.
 
 Brian 'Head' Welch told a radio station in California that his bandmates respected his decision to leave. A replacement guitarist has yet to be named by Korn, who are currently at work on their eighth studio album. Welch added that he would appear at a church in Bakersfield to explain how he "got to this place in life". The remaining members of Korn, who are known for their hardcore brand of rock, said they hoped Welch "finds the happiness he is looking for".
 
 The 34-year-old made reference to the band's aggressive brand of music and its young fans in his parting statement. "Anger is a good thing, and if kids want to listen to Korn, good, but there's happiness after the anger," he told his local radio station in Bakersfield. "I'm going to show it through my actions, how much I love my fans," added Welch. Korn have enjoyed a moderate degree of chart success in the UK, with 10 singles breaking into the Top 40. Their best performance to date in the UK has been 2002's Here To Stay, which reached number 12, while their album Untouchables, released in the same year, made it to number four.

He plans to attend a church event in Bakersfield to explain his decision and will appear there to discuss how he found happiness.
The remaining members of Korn are supportive of Welch's choice and hope he finds happiness.

tinyllama:1.1b: Rock group Korn has announced that its lead guitarist has resigned from the band after experiencing a religious awakening.

Brian "Head" Welch informed his bandmates of his decision on his personal website, stating: "After years of this being my life, I've come to the realization that hardcore is more or less what I want and love to do with my life now."
Welch explained that he made the move to find peace after experiencing a spiritual awakening, adding that the remaining members of Korn hoped he finds "happiness in his new reality".
The band has since confirmed they will release their eighth studio album without him, despite having yet to name a replacement guitarist.
tinydolphin:1.1b: In a recent interview with a California radio station, Korn guitarist Brian "Head" Welch announced his decision to quit the music business after facing a religious awakening and felt this was the right time for him to do so.
He plans to appear at a church in Bakersfield to explain his life choices to fellow fans.

While the remaining members of Korn, who are known for their hardcore rock sound, expressed hope that Welch finds happiness through his music, they will also support his decision if he desires to continue pursuing his passion.
